trans-unit.source: Causes a detailed list of locks at the time of a deadlock or a timeout to be written to the error log (typically the file derby.log). For a deadlock, describes the cycle of locks which caused the deadlock. For a timeout, prints the entire lock list at the time of the timeout. This property is meaningful only if the derby.locks.monitor property is set to true.

seg-source.mrk: Causes a detailed list of locks at the time of a deadlock or a timeout to be written to the error log (typically the file derby.log).
For a deadlock, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> describes the cycle of locks which caused the deadlock.
For a timeout, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> prints the entire lock list at the time of the timeout.
This property is meaningful only if the derby.locks.monitor property is set to true.

target.mrk: Causes a detailed list of locks at the time of a deadlock or a timeout to be written to the error log (typically the file derby.log).
For a deadlock, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> describes the cycle of locks which caused the deadlock.
For a timeout, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> prints the entire lock list at the time of the timeout.
This property is meaningful only if the derby.locks.monitor property is set to true.

trans-unit.source: This level of debugging is intrusive: it can alter the timing of the application, reduce performance severely, and produce a large error log file. It should be used with care.

seg-source.mrk: This level of debugging is intrusive: it can alter the timing of the application, reduce performance severely, and produce a large error log file.
It should be used with care.

target.mrk: This level of debugging is intrusive: it can alter the timing of the application, reduce performance severely, and produce a large error log file.
It should be used with care.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic; the change takes effect immediately. For information about dynamic changes to properties, see <xref href="crefproperdynstat.dita#crefproperdynstat"/>.
